caption:
TABLE 2: AEE and runtime (for Sintel) measured at different 
components (NetC: a feature encoder, NetE: a multi-scale flow 
decoder) and pyramid levels of LiteFlowNet [13] trained on 
Things3D. The percentage change is relative to the previous level.

TABLE 3: AEE of LiteFlowNet2 trained on Chairs using different 
training protocols against LiteFlowNet [13].

TABLE 4: AEE on the Chairs testing set. Models are trained on 
the Chairs training set.

different configurations. Out-Noc (or Out-All): Percentage of er-
roneous pixels in non-occluded areas (or in total). Fl-bg (or Fl-fg): 
Percentage of optical flow outliers averaged only over background 
(or foreground) regions. (Note: 1 Comparing to LiteFlowNet [13], 
LiteFlowNet2 uses a simplified (pseudo) network structure for 
flow inference and regularization at level 2 on KITTI.)

testing set can be improved from 4.86 to 4.54 for the Clean pass

further reduced the amount of augmentation for spatial motion as

9.38% on KITTI 2015.
